channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024030887
item.description:
Report X-2024030887

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was pulling packages out of the IC belt, he noticed that a package was on its side and with a wet corner. he told his manger. DescribePack: because the package was on its side one bottle leaked out about one or two ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the manager called QA and QA went to the area pick the package and brought to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030770
item.description:
Report X-2024030770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024030297
item.description:
Report E-2024030297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to 1' x 1' area on the trailer floor and a 1' x 4' area on the trailer wall due to a cracked tote corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then neutralized and cleaned with soda ash and absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL, USING THE PROPER PPE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR WASTE DISPOSAL.
